s: I originally found out about The Broods because one of my favorite artists, Meg Myers, was the opening act for them at the concert I just went to May 4th. Since I wasn't familiar with them, of course I went to YouTube and looked them up. Sure enough I discovered I loved every song and that ...

I just love Broods. Electro, great harmonies, catchy tunes. I'm lost as to why they are not massive. ... This is a great album from a wonderful duo. It arrived before due date (nice surprise), unfortunately the inner sleeve was slightly torn on all three enclosed sides and not properly adhered at the sides of the open end. It’s fine to keep (for me) but just something for manufacturer/distributor to know. Otherwise a worthy vinyl ...

The fourth full-length album from NZ brother and sister Broods, Space Island, is an exploration of grief and all it's many dimensions: it'sunpredictable nature and refusal to follow any linear path, it's incredible capacity to bring great clarity and transformation.
